Star Wars: the Clone Wars - Freeform
Post-Paranormal Liberation War Arc (My Hero Academia)

One year after the Pan-Pacific Republic triumphed over the Paranormal Liberation Front, the world prepares to embrace a future free of villainy. With All For One's dark plans gone for good, the forces of villainy appear to be finally defeated.

But in the shadows of this peace, a new and dangerous threat emerges: the Western European Federation.

This powerful faction has rapidly remilitarized, driven by a hatred of Quirks, which they call a "plague" and "unnatural disease." They view Quirk-bearers as a threat to their way of life, and threatens the democratic European States Allied Forces with war. Their ultranationalist leaders have ignited fanatical and religious loyalty, pushing for a world order devoid of Quirks.

Behind the curtain is Leonid Rasputin Dragunov, the long-thought-dead nemesis of Raleigh Morrison and Hero Batch 99. Dragunov, and the Knights of Stain, resumes their mission to destroy the Hero society and eradicate all Quirks, this time with the full military and political might of the Western European Federation and its citizens.

As the Pan-Pacific Republic recovers from its past war, the Western European Federation and the Knights of Stain plans their next moves carefully...
Bakugou Katsuki & Midoriya Izuku are Childhood Friends

Bakugou Katsuki and Midoriya Izuku have been friends since childhood and even though Izuku got a quirk and Katsuki didn't, that hasn't stopped them from being practically inseparable. Years go by and it is time for high school entrance exams, but when Izuku offers to help his best friend train to get into UA, he refuses. On his walk home he gets attacked by a sludge villian, but to his surprise, his idol, All Might, has saved him. After he clings to his idol, they end up talking, but what about?

This fic follows Bakugo and Kirishima as they navigate their final year at UA. With mounting pressure pushing them in unexpected ways, their friendship evolves through the blood, sweat, and...feelings?

Will be updated the tags and rating as the story progresses. *wink*

Chapter 5 has been posted!

Past One For All Users (My Hero Academia)

Imari grew up as a twin to Izuku Midoriya. One developing a quirk at a young age, another not. Trying to surf through high school with her Elemental Wolf Quirk, but hurricane after hurricane as the League of Villains, All For One, Overhaul, and MORE are somehow always in your way to achieve your one goal of becoming a great pro-hero to finally bring peace to all villains, heroes, and those in-between.
Follow Imari on her journey into becoming a true hero at UA high with her brother and the rest the UA gang, to find out who she is and who she'll truly become.

Bakugou Katsuki Has a Big Dick

Izuku Midoriya has been sheltered from the kingdom and the world for most of his twenty-one years of life, kept locked away in the castle from Alphas and suitors. He is kept under close watch, for he is the kingdom's Chosen Omega and their future. He has been guarded all his life by his personal protector, the great swordsman Yagi Toshinori. Inexplicably, his father the Duke decides that his son needs an additional guard, and hosts a competition for prize of protecting the most important Omega in the realm. The victor is a Beta male who crashes his way into Izuku's life, and later into his heart. Both of their secrets threaten to crush and shatter the kingdom, should they choose to let them.

Aizawa Shouta | Eraserhead is So Done

“How do you think he acted when he was convincing your mother’s family to give her to him?” Todoroki’s brow furrowed in confusion, and Ochako could tell he had never thought about it before. “I find it hard to believe that a parent would sell a child into a life of hardship unless there was no way to avoid it… and since you said that Endeavor paid to support her family’s ‘lifestyle,’ financial stability was part of the deal. On the surface, that comes off as a rather caring thing to do for your in-laws.”
“Gods Ochako, is that really how you wanna play this?”
Neither Katsuki or Todoroki had gotten where she was going yet so she grinned at Izuku, truly the smartest of them, and continued, “He had to have been on his best behavior to win them over- or else trying to propose a quirk marriage would have gone off the rails.”
“The fuck are you talking about?!” Katsuki snapped, obviously irritated and on edge about this situation as a whole.
“Endeavor can’t go to my parents to try to arrange a marriage like he did with his own wife.” She soothed, squeezing the tense, sweaty hand in her grasp. "He has to convince me that letting myself become your wife is my best option- and that means he has to impress me.”

At nineteen, Aizawa Shouta is just another teenager working his way through University and life with his goal of becoming a Social Worker to look after children (in the hope of giving others a better experience than what he lived through) just over a year away… if he can afford his tuition next year.

Waiting tables, cleaning, tutoring and serving coffee is one thing but, with the cost of living rising and his apartment’s lease-agreement up for review?

He needs a rapid cash-injection.

A rapid cash-injection that, thanks to Kayama Nemuri and his omega-biology, shouldn’t be too hard to get.

Other things being… hard, however, wasn’t something he’d been anticipating because accompanying alphas to galas, business functions and other social events as simple eye-candy wasn’t such a sordid thing…

Was it?

mentions and descriptions of past abuse

Look at me.

Notice me.

Think of me.

Miss me.

Love me.

“Deku.”

Izuku’s mind goes blank. He looks behind him and Katsuki is standing on the Uraraka’s doorstep, face pinched in an unfamiliar expression. His eyes are pale and he’s taking deep breaths that leave him in a cloud in the cold winter air.

Izuku doesn’t know how he can take this. Izuku doesn’t know if he can take this. He can’t assuage whatever misplaced guilt Katsuki has, or whatever this is. He didn’t know what was going on. Katsuki hadn’t even spoken to him since that one fateful trip to the lake. Why would he try to explain any of this, he didn’t owe Izuku jack shit. The only person who really owed him anything was in a labelled plastic box on her mother’s kitchen counter.

Fuck.

Midoriya Inko Adopts Shigaraki Tomura | Shimura Tenko
Yagi Toshinori | All Might Adopts Shigaraki Tomura | Shimura Tenko
Yagi Toshinori | All Might Saves Shigaraki Tomura | Shimura Tenko

Bakugou and Midoriya were friends as kids. Bakugou was quirkless, and Midoriya wasn't, but that didn't matter to them. Together the two wanted to become heroes. Bakugou wanted to prove himself to a world that said he couldn't, and Midoriya wanted to escape the path to villainy that his dad, All For One, has placed him on.

However nothing stays the same forever. As a twist of events, spurred on by a momentary decision brings the future crashing down, Midoriya's dad is killed and he is brought into the fold of the HPSC where he is raised to be a hero, (and he discovers that heroism isn't all he thought it was).

Midoriya (Now Akatani Mikumo) now works for the commission, while Bakugou is trying to become the hero he needs to be to not only find out what happened to his friend, but to also figure out how to save him. Yet the shadows of the past continue to haunt the present, as the pair of old friends have to rediscover their friendship and learn together how to fight to save the future.

Bakugou Katsuki is a Good Friend

Mitsuki didn't know the first thing about being a mother even after a year of being one. But she was trying her best. A best that had her helping a lost boy with blue hair and red eyes.

Even after raising two sons, Mitsuki still didn't feel like she knew what being a mother was truly like. But like every time that feeling hit, she pushed to try her best. A best that wouldn't let her turn a blind eye to a white haired boy in dirty clothes on the streets.

It had been sixteen years since Mitsuki became a mother, fifteen years since she adopted her second son, eight years since she adopted her third son, and now she watching her youngest son strive to be a hero like his brothers before him. Maybe she did know what being a mother was like after all.

Todoroki Shouto Has One for All Quirk

The camera zooms in, showing small flames that lick the ice, which melts away from the victim’s hand. The middle-school hero then works to unfreeze just enough of the villain to free his friend, who falls to his knees and starts coughing. When the villain starts moving again, the hero re-freezes him using his right hand. Then he steps back, runs a hand through messy green hair, and flashes a sheepish smile towards the camera.

A fire and ice quirk. Endeavor’s eyes are boring into Shouto.

It’s the quirk Shouto should have had.

Even though Todoroki Shouto is quirkless, he still wants to be a hero. He knows it will never happen. However, when he saves a classmate during the sports festival, he captures the attention of his father’s greatest rival. For the first time, somebody believes in him. This changes everything.

It Gets Worse Before It Gets Better

In this post UA graduation series, a cluster of vicious murders play out across the district and pull several of our now pro heroes in to help solve the ever expanding case load.

But for Uraraka, the identity of the latest victim throws her into the thick of it as the investigation hits a little too close to home. Despite the elevated threat for the women working the case of this unknown serial killer, our young pro hero ends up biting off more than she can chew as more bodies are added to the count.

Unfortunately for her, a series of well intended choices forces our heroine into a position that ends up providing far more knowledge on the killer than she’d ever expected. Will Uraraka be able to separate herself from the damage done to help solve the case once and for all? Or will she end up down the rabbit hole and ensnared in the same fate as the others?

Let the chase begin.

If there is a good thing you can say about Izuku Midoriya, it is his persistence! Nothing can make him stop dreaming about his future next to Kacchan as the hero duo that will save the world. Of course, he will become a hero if he survives today, being brought back into the real world by the rest of the class laughing at him.

A slow burn about how Izuku Midoriya tries everything to help others until he slowly joins the LOV.

In "Electric Blood," Denki Kaminari’s life takes a dark turn after a mysterious encounter with Hitoshi Shinso. An unexpected mutation in Shinso's Brainwashing Quirk transforms Denki into something more than human—a vampire with a new, unending thirst for electricity.Now, Denki’s powers have surged to dangerous levels, and he must "feed" on energy to avoid losing control. As he battles his new instincts, Denki and Shinso work together in secret, searching for a way to reverse the transformation. But with classmates starting to notice Denki’s strange behavior and his growing struggle against his dark urges, can they find a cure before he succumbs fully to the darkness within?
